meanings.definition: The extent of a subject or area of study
meanings.sent1: The scopes of our research include biology and chemistry.
meanings.sent2: She explored the scopes of literature and history in her thesis.
meanings.sent3: The scopes of math and art collided in the new curriculum.
meanings.sent4: The scopes of imagination know no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The vast scopes of the universe left him in awe.

meanings.definition: An instrument for viewing or examining
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a microscope to examine the specimen.
meanings.sent2: The detective's scope revealed hidden details in the crime scene.
meanings.sent3: The pirate's scope helped him spot the treasure from afar.
meanings.sent4: Her scope of vision widened with the new glasses.
meanings.sent5: The photographer adjusted the scope to capture the perfect shot.
